quiz.question: In an Agile project, how is scope managed to accommodate evolving requirements?
options: By freezing the scope baseline at the start of the project
By using a Product Backlog that is continuously refined
By implementing a strict Integrated Change Control process
By delivering all scope items in a single release
quiz.correct_answer: By using a Product Backlog that is continuously refined

quiz.question: What is the primary purpose of Rolling Wave Planning in Agile scope management?
options: To define all project details upfront
To progressively elaborate work as it becomes clearer
To prevent scope changes during the project lifecycle
To ensure all deliverables are completed in one iteration
quiz.correct_answer: To progressively elaborate work as it becomes clearer

quiz.question: Which Agile artifact is most commonly used to manage scope changes?
options: Scope Baseline
Product Backlog
Integrated Change Control Register
Work Breakdown Structure (WBS)

quiz.question: How does the Definition of Done (DoD) contribute to scope management in Agile projects?
options: It freezes the scope baseline to prevent changes
It ensures completed work meets predefined acceptance criteria
It limits the scope to high-priority tasks only
It eliminates the need for stakeholder feedback
quiz.correct_answer: It ensures completed work meets predefined acceptance criteria

quiz.question: During a Sprint Review, a stakeholder requests a new feature. How should the team handle this scope change?
options: Reject the request to avoid scope creep
Add the feature to the Product Backlog for prioritization
Immediately implement the feature in the current sprint
Freeze the scope baseline to prevent further changes
quiz.correct_answer: Add the feature to the Product Backlog for prioritization

quiz.question: What is the role of frequent feedback loops in Agile scope management?
options: To finalize the scope baseline early in the project
To ensure deliverables align with evolving stakeholder needs
To prevent any changes to the project scope
To eliminate the need for scope verification
quiz.correct_answer: To ensure deliverables align with evolving stakeholder needs

quiz.question: Which of the following is a key benefit of incremental delivery in Agile scope management?
options: It eliminates the need for scope planning
It allows stakeholders to evaluate progress and provide feedback
It prevents scope changes during the project lifecycle
It ensures all deliverables are completed in one iteration
quiz.correct_answer: It allows stakeholders to evaluate progress and provide feedback

quiz.question: How does Agile governance differ from traditional Integrated Change Control (ICC) in managing scope changes?
options: Agile governance uses formal approval boards for scope changes
Agile governance integrates scope changes through backlog refinement
Agile governance prevents scope changes during the project lifecycle
Agile governance freezes the scope baseline at the start of the project
quiz.correct_answer: Agile governance integrates scope changes through backlog refinement

quiz.question: What is the primary focus of scope management in Agile projects?
options: Delivering all planned scope items in a single release
Ensuring flexibility to adapt to changing requirements
Freezing the scope baseline to prevent changes
Defining all project details upfront
quiz.correct_answer: Ensuring flexibility to adapt to changing requirements

quiz.question: Which Agile event is most commonly used to validate scope alignment with stakeholder expectations?
options: Sprint Planning
Sprint Review
Daily Standup
Retrospective
